result.markdown: --- title: "Water Insecurity" description: Water insecurity differ spatially throughout the United States. In this data visualization, we explored which counties have the greatest percent of households lacking plumbing. format: html: code-fold: true execute: message: false warning: false echo: true --- Data curated by Niha Pereira for Tidy Tuesday from U.S. Census Bureau data. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidytuesdayR) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT ="") tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2025-01-28') water_insecurity_2022 <- tuesdata$water_insecurity_2022 water_insecurity_2023 <- tuesdata$water_insecurity_2023 water_insecurity_2022 <- water_insecurity_2022 |> dplyr::mutate( geometry = purrr::map(geometry, \(geo) { eval(parse(text = geo)) } ) ) water_insecurity_2023 <- water_insecurity_2023 |> dplyr::mutate( geometry = purrr::map(geometry, \(geo) { eval(parse(text = geo)) } ) ) top10_lacking <- water_insecurity_2022 |> mutate(greatest_lacking=percent_lacking_plumbing) |> arrange(desc(greatest_lacking)) |> slice_head(n=10) ggplot(top10_lacking, aes(x=reorder(name, greatest_lacking), y=greatest_lacking))+ geom_col(fill="pink")+ coord_flip()+ labs( title = "Top 10 areas lacking plumbing in the U.S. in 2022", x="County Name", y="Percent Lacking Plumbing" ) + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](WaterInsecurity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
